comments.text:
I don't think I've ever started a political collum with 'if it was only the 
crack...' before and I sure won't start for this waste of (much) skin. Ford 
is a alchoholic, wife beater, one time drug dealer himself, and under 
extortion from the 'Ndrangetian mafia (at BEST it's them).

Alot of politicians do coke. Alot of chefs do coke. Alot of professors do 
coke. I've worked with all of them and I can only think of a few times 
where they had a public meltdown like Ford. By the time you get to that 
level of power you have the ability to do a bump and go work a room, serve 
out 200 at a sitting or teach a class- Ford simply can't keep his sheit 
wired tight. The drinking, the unprofessional outburts, the wierd random 
threats to sue people, the videos, the crack, drinking and assault...
I mean, even besides his narcotic faults (that I honestly would be willing 
to overlook if he were decent at his job) he's just not a good leader.

I'm worried about why it's taken this long to censor him and I wonder who's 
protected him for these past ten years and what they got out of it.﻿

comments.text:
I used to live in Etobicoke where Rob Ford was a city councillor, if 
anybody protected him it was Ron Taverner ( A constable who runs a local 
police station who is a close Ford family friend,among others) plus 
Etobicoke residents do not care what Mayor Rob Ford does because (in their 
words) "It's on his personal time, he does not take taxpayer money" (side 
note:Rob Ford has for 3 years asked low level staffers to buy him booze, 
his booze bill was $4000 a month of taxpayer money) In the words of his 
brother Doug Ford (who just so happens to be city councillor of Rob Ford's 
old ward in Etobicoke, has gone on record saying "Rob Ford could commit 
murder in broad day light at Toronto City Hall, and get overwhelmingly 
re-elected".  It's enough to make someone throw up.
